intro: Pyrethrum galushkoi, commonly known as the Galushko's pyrethrum, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like yellow flowers with white centers. The plant produces fine, hair-like structures called trichomes on its leaves and stems, which are responsible for synthesizing natural pyrethrins—compounds with insecticidal properties. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun for optimal growth. Due to its chemical composition, it is of interest in both horticulture and pest control research.
